definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The brothers started to quarrel, then they decided to go to town and bring the matter before the judges.
sentences.chinese: 實在爭執不下，他們就決定到鎮上去，讓法官來解決。

sentences.english: But company disapprobation, both sides does not fall for this conflict.
sentences.chinese: 但公司不答應，雙方爲此爭執不下。

sentences.english: Several Olympic reporters have debated how to pronounce Bolt's first name.
sentences.chinese: 幾名奧運會記者就博爾特本人的名字發音爭執不下。

sentences.english: Thus for a long time they disputed.
sentences.chinese: 他們就這樣長時間爭執不下。
